channel.title: Digital Logic Circuits on Cloudian
channel.description: Recent content in Digital Logic Circuits on Cloudian

item.title: Bi-stable Flip Flop
item.description: At the heart of an SRAM cell lies a bistable flip-flop, which is a circuit capable of holding one of two stable states: logic ‘0’ or logic ‘1’. This flip-flop is typically constructed using two cross-coupled inverters

item.title: SRAM
item.description: Fills 2 needs: direct interface with CPU at speeds not attainable by [[Content/CALAS/Theories/DRAM|DRAM]]s replace DRAMs in systems with very low power consumption In 1st use, SRAM serves as cache memory, interfacing between DRAMs and the CPU !
